variable.name: Sex
variable.description: Gender of participant as identified by survey of patient/patient's parent

variable.name: Med_birth_year
variable.description: Year of birth

variable.name: Chip_type
variable.description: Array on which participants were genotyped
variable.comment: Affy 6.0=Affymetrix Human SNP Array 6.0; Axiom=Affymetrix Axiom Genotyping Array; NR=Not Released (pending); Omni=Illumina Omni Array; Quad=Illumina Human610; V1=Illumina HumanHap550v1; V3=Illumina HumanHap550v3

variable.name: Med_Rating
variable.description: Indicates severity of a patient's medical condition
variable.comment: Rules for rating of individual medical disorders (N=230) were developed by trained raters. These rules are also available from the study team. 0=No medical problems; 1=Minor, no CNS impact; 2=Moderate; 3=Significant; 4=Major.

variable.name: INT_TYPE
variable.description: Type of Clinical Interview
variable.comment: AP=Adult Proband (ages 18 and up); MP= Middle Proband (ages 11-17); MI=Middle Informant; YPI= Young Proband Informant (for ages 8-10)

variable.name: ADD011
variable.description: Attention Deficit Disorder: Did you often have trouble paying attention or keeping your mind on your school, work, chores, or other activities that you were doing?

variable.name: ADD012
variable.description: Attention Deficit Disorder: Did you often have problems following instructions and often fail to finish school, work, or other things you meant to get done?

variable.name: ADD013
variable.description: Attention Deficit Disorder: Did you often dislike, avoid, or put off school or homework (or any other activity requiring concentration)

variable.name: ADD014
variable.description: Attention Deficit Disorder: Did you often lose things you needed for school or projects at home (assignments or books) or make careless mistakes in school work or other activities?

variable.name: ADD015
variable.description: Attention Deficit Disorder: Did you often have trouble making plans, doing things that had to be done in a certain kind of order, or that had a lot of different steps?

variable.name: ADD016
variable.description: Attention Deficit Disorder: Did you often have people tell you that you did not seem to be listening when they spoke to you or that you were daydreaming?

variable.name: ADD020

variable.name: ADD021
variable.description: Attention Deficit Disorder: Did you often blurt out answers to other people's questions before they finished speaking or interrupt people abruptly?

variable.name: ADD022
variable.description: Attention Deficit Disorder: Did you often join other people's conversations or have trouble waiting your turn (e.g., waiting in line, waiting for a teacher to call on you in class)?

variable.description: Attention Deficit Disorder: Did you have these difficulties at home (with your parents)?

variable.name: SEP500
variable.description: Separation Anxiety: Since you were 5 years old, has there ever been a time when you had a lot of worries about your (attachment figures) and were very upset or got sick (for example, felt sick to your stomach, headaches, thrown-up) when you were away from him/her?

variable.name: SEP501
variable.description: Separation Anxiety: Did you worry about this more than most children/people your age?

variable.name: SEP508
variable.description: Separation Anxiety: Has there ever been a time when you wanted to stay home from school or not go to other places (for example, sleep-overs) without your (attachment figures)?

variable.name: SEP509
variable.description: Separation Anxiety: When you knew that you were going to be away from home or (attachment figure(s)), did you get very upset and worry (e.g., when you learned (attachment figure(s)) were going on an upcoming trip or night out)?

variable.name: SEP510
variable.description: Separation Anxiety: Did you ever worry/have bad dreams about something terrible happening to you or your (attachment figures) so that you would not see them again?

variable.name: SEP511
variable.description: Separation Anxiety: Were you scared to be alone in your room (or any place in your house) or did you need your (attachment figure(s)) to stay with you while you fell asleep?

variable.name: SEP512
variable.description: Separation Anxiety: How long was your longest period of worry about your (attachment figures)? (Days)
variable.comment: Count in days For additional information, see: PMID:9690934; PMID:19242382

variable.name: SIP001
variable.description: SIPS - Structured Interview for Prodromal Symptoms: TROUBLE WITH FOCUS AND ATTENTION Severity Scale
variable.comment: 0=Absent;1=Questionably present;2=Mild;3=Moderate;4=Moderately severe;5=Severe;6=Extreme For additional information, see: McGlashan TH, Miller TJ, Woods SW, Rosen JL, Hoffman RE, Davidson L. Structured Interview for Prodromal Syndromes, Version 4.0. New Haven, CT: Prime Clinic Yale School of Medicine; 2003.

variable.name: SIP002
variable.description: SIPS - Structured Interview for Prodromal Symptoms: Trouble With Focus and Attention: Symptom Onset
variable.comment: 1=Less than 1 month; 2=Between 1 month and 1 year; 3=Greater than 1 year but not lifetime; 4=Lifetime or as long as participant can remember; 9=Unknown For additional information, see: McGlashan TH, Miller TJ, Woods SW, Rosen JL, Hoffman RE, Davidson L. Structured Interview for Prodromal Syndromes, Version 4.0. New Haven, CT: Prime Clinic Yale School of Medicine; 2003.
variable.value: Greater than 1 year but not lifetime
Lifetime or as long as participant can remember

variable.name: SIP003
variable.description: SIPS - PRIME SCREEN-REVISED: I think that I have felt that there are odd or unusual things going on that I can't explain.
variable.comment: 0=Definitely Disagree; 1=Somewhat Disagree; 2=Slightly Disagree; 3=Not Sure; 4=Slightly Agree; 5=Somewhat Agree; 6=Definitely Agree For additional information, see: Miller TJ, Cicchetti D, Markovich PJ, McGlashan TH, Woods SW. The SIPS screen: a brief self-report screen to detect the schizophrenia prodrome. Schizophr Res. 2004;70 (suppl1):78.

Structured Interview for Prodromal Syndromes, Version 4.0. New Haven, CT: Prime Clinic Yale School of Medicine; 2003.

variable.name: SIP038
variable.description: SIPS - Structured Interview for Prodromal Symptoms: Within the past 6 months, are you having a harder time getting your work or schoolwork done?
variable.comment: 0=No; 1=Yes; 9=Unknown For additional information, see: McGlashan TH, Miller TJ, Woods SW, Rosen JL, Hoffman RE, Davidson L. Structured Interview for Prodromal Syndromes, Version 4.0. New Haven, CT: Prime Clinic Yale School of Medicine; 2003.

variable.name: SIP039

variable.comment: 0=No; 1=Yes; 9=Unknown For additional information, see: McGlashan TH, Miller TJ, Woods SW, Rosen JL, Hoffman RE, Davidson L. Structured Interview for Prodromal Syndromes, Version 4.0. New Haven, CT: Prime Clinic Yale School of Medicine; 2003.

variable.comment: 0=Absent; 1=Questionably present; 2=Mild; 3=Moderate; 4=Moderately severe; 5=Severe but not psychotic; 6=Severe and psychotic For additional information, see: McGlashan TH, Miller TJ, Woods SW, Rosen JL, Hoffman RE, Davidson L. Structured Interview for Prodromal Syndromes, Version 4.0. New Haven, CT: Prime Clinic Yale School of Medicine; 2003.

variable.name: SIP042

variable.comment: 0=Rating from SIP30 was 0-3; 1=Less than 1 month; 2=Btw 1 month and 1 year; 3=Greater than 1 year, but not lifetime; 4=Lifetime or as long as I can remember; 9=Unknown For additional information, see: McGlashan TH, Miller TJ, Woods SW, Rosen JL, Hoffman RE, Davidson L. Structured Interview for Prodromal Syndromes, Version 4.0. New Haven, CT: Prime Clinic Yale School of Medicine; 2003.
variable.value: Greater than 1 year, but not lifetime
Lifetime or as long as I can remember

variable.name: SOC001

variable.name: peit_genus
variable.description: PEIT: Penn Emotion Identification Test Genus
variable.comment: Genus is a family of related tests. The Penn Emotion Identification Test displays faces expressing one of four emotions (happy, sad, anger, fear) and neutral faces. The faces are presented one at a time, and the participant is asked to identify the emotion displayed from the set of four listed. The facial stimuli are balanced for sex, age, and ethnicity (Gur et al., 2002). PEITAB=Penn Emotion Identification Test Form A with 40 Total Test Trials; PEITC=Penn Emotion Identification Test Form C with 40 Total Test Trials; PEITD=Penn Emotion Identification Test Form D with 40 Total Test Trials; PEITE=Penn Emotion Identification Test Form D with 40 Total Test Trial.

variable.name: pwmt_genus
variable.description: PWMT: Penn Word Memory Test Genus
variable.comment: Genus is a family of related tests. The Penn Word Memory Test presents 20 target words that are then mixed with 20 foils equated for frequency, length, concreteness, and imageability . The participants are asked to memorize the target words as they are presented and after the presentation of the target words they are asked to indicate whether a word presented was included in the target list on a 1 to 4 scale (Gur et al., 2001; Gur et al., 2010). PWMT=Penn Word Memory Test with 40 Total Test Trials.

variable.name: volt_genus
variable.description: VOLT: Visual Object Learning Test Genus
variable.comment: Genus is a family of related tests. The Visual Object Learning Test uses Euclidean shapes as stimuli with the same paradigm as the word and face memory (Glahn et al., 1997; Gur et al., 2001; Gur et al., 2010). VOLT=Visual Object Learning Test with 20 Total Test Trials.
variable.value: Visual Object Learning Test with 20 Total Test Trials

variable.name: volt_valid
variable.description: VOLT: Visual Object Learning Test Valid Code
variable.comment: V=Valid; V2=Valid, problem occurred which affected performance, for a limited number of responses/mild to moderate effect; N=Not Valid; S=Skipped
variable.value: Valid, problem occurred which affected performance, for a limited number of responses/mild to moderate effect

variable.name: lnb_genus
variable.description: LNB: Letter N-Back Test Genus
variable.comment: Genus is a family of related tests. The Letter N-back test displays sequences of uppercase letters. In the 0-back condition, participants respond to a single target (i.e., X). In the 1-back condition they respond if the letter is identical to that preceding it. In the 2-back condition, they respond if the letter is identical to that presented two trials back (Gur et al., 2001; Gur et al., 2010; Ragland et al, 2002).

variable.name: lnb_valid
variable.description: LNB: Letter N-Back Test Valid Code
variable.comment: V=Valid; V2=Valid, problem occurred which affected performance, for a limited number of responses/mild to moderate effect; N=Not Valid; S=Skipped
variable.value: Valid, problem occurred which affected performance, for a limited number of responses/mild to moderate effect

variable.name: lnb_rtc
variable.description: LNB: Median Response Time for All Correct Responses to 0-Back, 1-Back, and 2-Back Trials

variable.name: lnb_mcr
variable.description: LNB: Number of Correct Responses to for 1-Back and 2-Back Trials

variable.name: lnb_mrtc
variable.description: LNB: Mean of the Median Response Time for Correct Responses for 1-Back (TP) and for 2-Back (TP) Trials

variable.name: lnb_tp0
variable.description: LNB: Number of Correct Responses to 0-Back Trials (TP)

variable.name: lnb_fp0
variable.description: LNB: Number of Incorrect Responses to 0-Back Trials (FP)

variable.name: pcet_genus
variable.description: PCET: Penn Conditional Exclusion Test Genus
variable.comment: Genus is a family of related tests. The Penn Conditional Exclusion Test presents four objects at a time, and the participant selects the object that does not belong with the other three based on one of three sorting principles. Sorting principles change, and feedback guides their identification (Gur et al., 2010; Kurtz et al., 2004).

variable.name: pcet_valid
variable.description: PCET: Penn Conditional Exclusion Test Valid Code
variable.comment: V=Valid; V2=Valid, problem occurred which affected performance, for a limited number of responses/mild to moderate effect; N=Not Valid; S=Skipped
variable.value: Valid, problem occurred which affected performance, for a limited number of responses/mild to moderate effect

variable.name: pcet_rtcr
variable.description: PCET: Median Response Time for Correct Responses

variable.name: pcet_rter
variable.description: PCET: Median Response Time for Incorrect Responses

variable.name: pcet_cat
variable.description: PCET: Number of Categories Achieved

variable.name: pcet_acc2
variable.description: PCET: Calculated Accuracy Measure
variable.comment: Accuracy is calculated as (PCET_CAT+1)*Number Correct/(Number Correct+Number Incorrect)

variable.name: pcpt_genus
variable.description: PCPT: Penn Continuous Performance Test Genus
variable.comment: Genus is a family of related tests. The Penn Continuous Performance Test presents 7-segment displays at a rate of 1/sec. The participants task is to press the space bar whenever the display forms a digit or a letter (Gur et al., 2001; Gur et al., 2010; Kurtz et al., 2001). PCPT=Penn Continuous Performance Test with 180 Total Test Trials between Numbers and Letters Categories.
variable.value: Penn Continuous Performance Test with 180 Total Test Trials between Numbers and Letters Categories

variable.name: pcpt_valid
variable.description: PCPT: Penn Continuous Performance Test Valid Code
variable.comment: V=Valid; V2=Valid, problem occurred which affected performance, for a limited number of responses/mild to moderate effect; N=Not Valid; S=Skipped
variable.value: Valid, problem occurred which affected performance, for a limited number of responses/mild to moderate effect

variable.name: plot_genus
variable.description: PLOT: Penn Line Orientation Test Genus
variable.comment: Genus is a family of related tests. The Penn Line Orientation Test presents two lines at an angle, and participants click on a button that makes one line rotate until it has the same angle as the other. The relative location of the lines and their sizes differ across trials (Gur et al., 2010). PLOT12=Penn Line Orientation Test with 12 Total Test Trials that rotate 6 degrees per mouse click; PLOT24=Penn Line Orientation Test with 24 Total Test Trials that rotate 3, 6, or 9 degrees per mouse click.
variable.value: Penn Line Orientation Test with 12 Total Test Trials that rotate 6 degrees per mouse click; PLOT24=Penn Line Orientation Test with 24 Total Test Trials that rotate 3, 6, or 9 degrees per mouse click.

variable.name: plot_valid
variable.description: PLOT: Penn Line Orientation Test Valid Code, by genus
variable.comment: V=Valid; V2=Valid, problem occurred which affected performance, for a limited number of responses/mild to moderate effect; N=Not Valid; S=Skipped
variable.value: Valid, problem occurred which affected performance, for a limited number of responses/mild to moderate effect

variable.name: plot_tc
variable.description: PLOT: Total Correct Responses for All Test Trials, by genus

variable.name: plot_tcrt
variable.description: PLOT: Median Response Time for Correct Trials, by genus

variable.name: plot_off
variable.description: PLOT: Total Positions Off for All Test Trials, by genus

variable.name: plot_pc
variable.description: PLOT: Percent Correct Responses for All Test Trials, by genus

variable.name: wrat_genus
variable.description: WRAT: Wide Range Assessment Test Genus
variable.comment: Genus is a family of related tests. A brief standardized reading test from the Wide Range Achievement Test that helps determine participants ability to complete the battery and to provide an estimate of IQ (Wilkinson GS and Robertson GJ. Wide Range Achievement Test 4 Professional Manual. Lutz, FL: Psychological Assessment Resources; 2006).

variable.name: wrat_valid
variable.description: WRAT: Wide Range Assessment Test Valid Code
variable.comment: V=Valid; V2=Valid, problem occurred which affected performance, for a limited number of responses/mild to moderate effect; N=Not Valid; S=Skipped
variable.value: Valid, problem occurred which affected performance, for a limited number of responses/mild to moderate effect

variable.description: WRAT: Wide Range Assessment Test 4 Total Raw Score

variable.name: wrat_cr_std
variable.description: WRAT: Wide Range Assessment Test Total Standard Score
variable.comment: Standard Scores are adjusted by age according to WRAT4 Manual
